Dear ___,

I hope this letter finds you on the road to recovery following your recent hospital stay. I am writing to provide you with a summary of your hospitalization and the care you received during your time at [Hospital's Name]. 

You were admitted on March 10, 2024, due to a fall that resulted in a subsequent loss of consciousness. Upon admission, your level of consciousness was decreased, with a Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) recorded at 11, along with slurred speech. After a CT scan the following day, a hemorrhagic stroke was identified in the right hemisphere of your brain. 

Our medical team began treatment promptly. On March 11, 2024, tests indicated a slightly low hemoglobin level, elevated white blood cell count, and an elevated International Normalized Ratio (INR), which suggested prolonged bleeding time. You were prescribed Mannitol every six hours to manage cerebral edema, and the dosage of Antihypertensives was adjusted according to your blood pressure readings.

Throughout your stay, you were closely monitored. Despite these efforts, significant neurological improvement was not observed, and your GCS remained at 11. You also experienced right-sided weakness and continued slurred speech, alongside signs of agitation and confusion. Safety measures were diligently maintained to prevent further falls.

Your condition was discussed with your family, emphasizing the critical nature of your health status and the need for ongoing care. You showed resilience throughout this challenging period, and our team made every effort to ensure your comfort and safety. As you transition back home, it is crucial to keep in close contact with your healthcare provider for continued management and to adhere strictly to the prescribed medication regimen. Moreover, arrangements for assistance at home might be necessary to support your daily activities safely.

Should you have any further questions or need assistance, please do not hesitate to contact us or your healthcare provider. We wish you all the best for your recovery and well-being.

Sincerely,

Dr. ___
